title: 109_hr3869
content:
The Act may be cited as the "Freedom and Flexibility to Rebuild Act of 2005" and includes provisions for Louisiana Flexibility. The "Freedom and Flexibility to Rebuild Act of 2005" includes provisions for Louisiana Flexibility, amending high priority projects by designating eligible projects under the surface transportation program in Louisiana. The "Freedom and Flexibility to Rebuild Act of 2005" amends transportation improvement projects in Louisiana by designating eligible projects under the surface transportation program. The "Freedom and Flexibility to Rebuild Act of 2005" amends transportation improvement projects in Louisiana by designating eligible projects under the surface transportation program as specified by the State. SEC. 3. MISSISSIPPI FLEXIBILITY. (a) High Priority Projects in Mississippi are amended to be eligible for assistance under the surface transportation program established by the state. This includes various designated projects listed in the Safe, Accountable, Flexible, Efficient Transportation Equity Act.
(b) Transportation Improvements in Mississippi are also amended to align with the state's designated projects under the same Act. The projects listed in sections 1934 and 3044(a) of the Safe, Accountable, Flexible, Efficient Transportation Equity Act are amended to be eligible for assistance under Mississippi's surface transportation program. This includes designated projects under 23 U.S.C. 133. SEC. 4. ALABAMA FLEXIBILITY. (a) High Priority Projects.--Amendments are made to various projects in the table under the Safe, Accountable, Flexible, Efficient Transportation Equity Act by designating them as eligible for assistance under the surface transportation program established by the State of Alabama.

(b) Transportation Improvements.--Projects in the table under the same Act are amended to be eligible for assistance. Amendments are made to various projects in the table under the Safe, Accountable, Flexible, Efficient Transportation Equity Act by designating them as eligible for assistance under the surface transportation program established by the State of Alabama. This includes bus and bus-related facilities, with specific project numbers being amended to qualify for assistance.
